title: Docker Utils
content:
Docker Essential Operations

1. Important Commands

  • docker ps: List running containers.
  • docker ps -a: List all containers (including stopped ones).
  • docker system prune -a: DANGER! Removes all unused images, containers, and networks.

2. Docker Compose Profiles

Use profiles to group services (e.g., dev, test, debug).

services:
  web:
    image: my-app:latest
  db-admin:
    image: phpmyadmin
    profiles:
      - debug
  selenium-tests:
    image: selenium/standalone-chrome
    profiles:
      - test

Execute profile: docker compose --profile debug up

3. Docker Compose Lifecycle

ActionCommandDescription
Startdocker compose up -dStarts stack in background. Creates networks/volumes.
Clean Exitdocker compose downStops and removes containers and networks.
Deep Cleandocker compose down -vStops containers and deletes volumes.
Logsdocker compose logs -fFollow real-time output.
Builddocker compose build --no-cacheFresh rebuild of images.

4. Makefile Configuration

Simplify your workflow using a Makefile. Note: Use tabs for indents.

# Variables
COMPOSE = docker compose

.PHONY: up down rebuild logs ps prune

up:
	$(COMPOSE) up -d

down:
	$(COMPOSE) down

rebuild:
	$(COMPOSE) up -d --build

logs:
	$(COMPOSE) logs -f --tail=100

prune:
	docker system prune -a --volumes -f

How to execute:

make up | make rebuild | make logs
